meanings.definition: A substance that stabilizes an emulsion by increasing the kinetic stability of the system.
meanings.sent1: The emulsifiers in the salad dressing kept the oil and vinegar mixed together.
meanings.sent2: Food labels often list emulsifiers as ingredients to explain how products stay mixed.
meanings.sent3: The emulsifiers at the party were the twins who always kept everyone mingling.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence acted as the emulsifiers in the chaotic office, keeping everyone working smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The emulsifiers in the paint prevented the colors from separating, creating a beautiful blend.

meanings.definition: An ingredient used in food processing to help mix ingredients that do not normally mix well together.
meanings.sent1: The baker added emulsifiers to the cake batter to ensure the oil and water combined perfectly.
meanings.sent2: Emulsifiers are essential in making creamy ice cream by blending fats and liquids smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The emulsifiers in the kitchen were like magical potions that made all ingredients get along.
meanings.sent4: His negotiation skills acted as emulsifiers in the tense meeting, bringing opposing views together.
meanings.sent5: The emulsifiers in the shampoo kept the oil and water mixed, giving a consistent texture.
